workflow.name: Reduce meeting no-shows with Gemini AI, email & WhatsApp reminders for Calendly
workflow.description:
## **How it works:**
This n8n workflow automates communication with meeting invitees to decrease no-show rates by sending timely email and WhatsApp reminders, and a clarification request if more information is needed to prepare the meeting.

## **Step-by-step:**
The workflow is triggered by an incoming email notification from Calendly about a newly scheduled meeting.

- It uses AI to extract key meeting data from the email content.
- It checks if the invitee didn't provide sufficient information, and, if there is a need for more information, sends a clarification request email.
- It calculates the waiting time required for the 24-hour and 1-hour reminders.
- It uses an If node to determine the correct waiting path based on the meeting time.
- It uses Wait nodes for timing the reminders correctly.
- Finally, it sends a reminder email and a WhatsApp reminder before the meeting. 

## **Customization Options:**
- Replace Google Gemini with your preferred LLM model (though Gemini works on the free tier).
- Tailor email and WhatsApp messages to speak your brand's language.
- Replace Twillio node to WhatsApp node to be a completly free usage flow.

parameters.text:
Hi {{$json["invitee_name"]}},

Just a quick reminder about our strategy call scheduled for {{$json["meeting_time"]}}, {{$json["meeting_date"]}} (EET).

We'll discuss how to scale smarter with AI and data-driven systems.

Join via: {{$json["meeting_link"]}}

Talk soon,
[HOST_NAME]
parameters.subject: Reminder: Your AI Strategy Call {{ $json.type === '24h' ? 'Tomorrow' : 'in 1 hour' }}

nodes.name: Check if More Info is Needed
Wait to send 1h before meeting after 24h

parameters.text:
Hi {{$json["invitee_name"]}},

I noticed you mentioned '{{$json["additional_info"]}}'. Could you please share more details before our call? This will help me tailor our session to your goals.

Looking forward to our meeting,

[HOST_NAME]
parameters.subject: Quick question before our strategy call

parameters.message: Hi {{ $('analyze email').item.json.output.invitee_name }}, just a reminder that your AI strategy call is {{ $('analyze email').item.json.output.meeting_date }} @ {{ $('analyze email').item.json.output.meeting_time }} (EET).\nJoin via: {{ $('analyze email').item.json.output.meeting_link }}\nLooking forward! - [HOST_NAME]

parameters.text:
=You are an AI assistant that extracts meeting information from Calendly booking emails.
Read the email and return a structured JSON with the following fields:
- invitee_name
- invitee_email
- phone_number
- meeting_date (format YYYY-MM-DD)
- meeting_time (HH:mm)
- meeting_link
- meeting_goal
- needs_more_info (true/false)
- additional_info (brief summary if attendee provided extra notes)

Time zone is always Eastern European Time (EET).
Keep the output strictly in JSON format, no additional text.
email: {{ $json.textPlain }}

parameters.content:
## Decrease no-shows with customizable reminders and follow-ups 
This n8n workflow automates communication with meeting invitees to decrease no-show rates by sending timely email and WhatsApp reminders, and a clarification request if more information is needed to prepare the meeting.

Overview of the Flow
The workflow is triggered by an incoming email notification (presumably from a system like Calendly or an online form) about a newly scheduled meeting.

It uses AI to extract key meeting data from the email content.

It checks if the invitee didn't provide sufficient information, and, if there is a need for more information, sends a clarification request email.

It calculates the waiting time required for the 24-hour and 1-hour reminders.

It uses an If node to determine the correct waiting path based on the meeting time.

It uses Wait nodes for timing the reminders correctly.

Finally, it sends a reminder email and a WhatsApp reminder before the meeting.

## Notification received 

Purpose: This node is the trigger. It monitors an IMAP email account for new meeting notification emails (e.g., from Calendly).

Action: Ensure the IMAP account credential is properly set up.

## Data Extraction 
AI Processing:
extract from email (AI Agent):

Purpose: Uses an LLM (Large Language Model) to analyze the plain text of the notification email and extract structured data.

Configuration: Verify the prompt to ensure it accurately instructs the model to extract invitee_name, invitee_email, phone_number, meeting_date (YYYY-MM-DD), meeting_time (HH:mm), meeting_link, meeting_goal, needs_more_info (boolean), and additional_info.

Credentials: Ensure the Google Gemini(PaLM) API account credential is set up for the LLM model node.

LLM model (Chat Google Gemini): Connects to the AI model used by the Agent.

Calculator and Structured Output Parser: These nodes are configured to support the AI Agent's structured data extraction.

## Is More Info Needed?

Purpose: Checks the boolean output needs_more_info from the "extract from email" node.

Condition: If $json.output.needs_more_info is true, the workflow proceeds to the next step on the true branch.

Send Clarification request (Email Send):

Purpose: Sends an email to the invitee asking for more details based on the additional_info provided.

Customization: Replace [HOST_EMAIL] and [HOST_NAME] with your actual information.

## Calculate Waiting Time:

Purpose: Calculates the wait time in hours for the 24-hour and 1-hour reminders, accounting for the email's received time and the meeting time (in EET).

Code Details: The code compares the meeting time with the email received time to calculate wait_24h and wait_1h (or 0 if the time has passed).

## When to send?

Purpose: Directs the workflow to the correct path based on the calculated wait times.

Conditions: The false branch (Wait to send 24h before meeting/Wait to send 1h before meeting after 24h) is for meetings more than one hour away. The true branch (Wait to send 1h before meeting) is for meetings that are one hour or less away (where wait_24h is 0).

Wait Nodes (Wait to send 24h..., Wait to send 1h..., Wait to send 1h... after 24h):

Purpose: Pauses the workflow for the calculated number of hours to ensure the reminders are sent at the optimal time (24h and 1h before the meeting).

Expression: The amount field uses the calculated values from the "Calculate Waiting Time" node.

## Send Reminders
Purpose: Sends the main meeting reminder email.

Customization:

Replace [HOST_EMAIL] and [HOST_NAME].

The subject line dynamically changes to include Tomorrow (24h reminder) or in 1 hour (1h reminder) using the ternary expression: {{ $json.type === '24h' ? 'Tomorrow' : 'in 1 hour' }}.

Send WhatsApp Reminder (Twilio):

Purpose: Sends a final reminder via WhatsApp (requires a Twilio account configured for WhatsApp).

Customization:

Replace [TWILIO_WHATSAPP_FROM] with your Twilio WhatsApp sender number.

Replace [HOST_NAME].

Ensure the expression for the To field correctly formats the invitee's phone number for Twilio

## Requirements and Customization Credentials:

IMAP (for "Notification received").

Google Gemini(PaLM) API (for "LLM model"). Can be replaced with preferred model.

Twilio (for "Send WhatsApp Reminder").

Placeholders: Replace [HOST_EMAIL], [HOST_NAME], and [TWILIO_WHATSAPP_FROM] with your information in the respective Email Send and Twilio nodes.

main.node: Wait to send 1h before meeting after 24h
Check if More Info is Needed

user.name: Razvan Bara

Whether you're launching your first product or scaling, I'll help you build an AI-powered, data-driven system that runs your business while you focus on strategic growth.

Let's discuss how strategic optimization combined with business intelligence and custom AI agents can transform your operations and accelerate your success.

Ready to scale smarter with AI and data?

Let's talk.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
